results.title: Sheepdog
results.creator_credit: John Alderson and British Sccreen Service
results.brief_description: The work of a typical English dog in the wild Welsh mountains. A study of a shepherd’s workmate, his sheepdog; used to protect flocks from marauding foxes, to round up stragglers, and to rescue injured lambs or sick ewes.
results.description: The work of a typical English dog in the wild Welsh mountains. A study of a shepherd’s workmate, his sheepdog; used to protect flocks from marauding foxes, to round up stragglers, and to rescue injured lambs or sick ewes.

results.title: Sheep: handle with care. Parts I-III
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A three part program that shows the different aspects of sheep management. Part 1 deals with Mustering, mouthing, teeth trimming, drenching and foot care. Part 2 deals wth crutching, vaccinating, lamb marking and drafting. Part 3 deals with shearing, branding, dipping and jetting

results.title: Sheep sheep sheep
results.brief_description: Illustrates the moods, rythms and images of sheep, using natrual sounds and no commentary. Shows sheep grazing, sleeping, waking and moving to the highlands.

results.title: Sheep ranching country: Southeastern Australia
results.brief_description: A study of sheep raising and wheat farming on the semi-arid plains region of South-Eastern Austalia. Emphasises the importance of wool and wheat exports to our economy.

results.title: Sheep in wood
results.brief_description: The film presents Jacques Hnizodvsky wroking in his studio on a woodcut of two rams locked in combat. Uses close-up photography to show each step in the process of making a woodcut, from preliminary setches to the artist’s proof. There is no narration.

results.title: Shed Tears for the River
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, David Corke and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Deals with the many environmental crises of the River Murray, past and present. The problems are emphasised by travelling along the river and talking to the people who are dependant upon it for water, irrigation, food and recreation. Script, David Corke; photography, Nicholas Alexander.

results.title: Shearing technique
results.brief_description: A demonstration showing correct methods of shearing sheep. A shearer demonstrates the most common faults found in shearing and slow-motion “shots” help to emphasise the important points of good shearing.

results.title: She wore a yellow ribbon
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Merian C. Cooper and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Considered one of John Ford’s finest Westerns, “She wore a yellow ribbon” is the epic tale of cavalry life on the harsh American frontier. John Wayne is Captain Brittles, about to retire from the cavalry, but called back by his troops to defend them from the Apache Indians who have declared Holy War on the white man. Only Brittles has enough knowledge of Apache life to devise a strategy which will prevent a bloody massacre. The stunning locations are in Monument Valley and the cinematography won an Academy Award for Winton C. Hoch. Also starring John Agar, Joanne Dru, Victor McLaglen and Ben Johnson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Ford, Merian C. Cooper and RKO Radio Pictures
